page.title: 07POP CULTURE IN LITTLE HULTON
page.content: Most pupils at our school enjoy { {pop music. Many start collecting {recrds before the age of ten.}Those that have favourite singers or groups {tend to buy pop magazines}to read about their idols. Some join fan clubs and many buy posters and pin- ups. All agreed that the{image}of the group presented in their T.V. videos was important. Indeed many admitted that the way their idols look is more important than the songs. Those who buy records tend to buy singles rather than E.P.'s or Albums. Some prefer to buy cassettes (the sound is stored on magnetic tape) because they are longer lasting,small and durable. However most favour records (large plastic discs) because there is more prestige to owning a record collection and because you also get a very attractive artistic sleeve.
